title: Cloud

| [#. Drawbridge](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge")                   | [+-\| Door](/wiki/Door "Door")              |
| [. Doorway](/wiki/Doorway "Doorway")                             | [{ Fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain")     |
| [\| Headstone](/wiki/Headstone "Headstone")                      | [.  Floor](/wiki/Floor "Floor")             |
| [>< Ladder](/wiki/Ladder "Ladder")                               | [. Ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice")                    |
| [# Iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars")                       | [} Lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava")                 |
| [} Moat](/wiki/Moat "Moat")                                      | [# Sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink")                 |
| [  Solid rock](/wiki/Solid_rock "Solid rock")                    | [>< Staircase](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase") |
| [\ Throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne")                                | [^" Trap](/wiki/Trap "Trap")                |
| [# Tree](/wiki/Tree "Tree")                                      | [- \| Wall](/wiki/Wall "Wall")              |
| [\~ Vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square") |                                             |

- - *Not to be confused with [poison cloud](/wiki/Poison_cloud "Poison cloud").*
  - *For other uses, see [Cloud (disambiguation)](/wiki/Cloud_\(disambiguation\) "Cloud (disambiguation)").*

A **cloud**, #[![Cloud.png](/images/d/d2/Cloud.png)](/wiki/File:Cloud.png), is a [dungeon feature](/wiki/Dungeon_feature "Dungeon feature") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)
  - [2.1 Plane of Air](#Plane_of_Air)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 Lethe patch](#Lethe_patch)
  - [4.2 Biodiversity patch](#Biodiversity_patch)
  - [4.3 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.4 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.5 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Clouds appear in the following areas:

- The home and locate levels of the [Wizard quest](/wiki/Wizard_quest "Wizard quest")
- Variations #1, #8 and #10 of the [Big Room](/wiki/Big_Room "Big Room") (dependent on chance), and
- The [Plane of Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air"), where far larger clouds appear.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

One of the [themed rooms](/wiki/Themed_room "Themed room") introduced in this version has a chance of generating a cloud at the center of the room. In addition, rays of fire that partially or completely evaporate [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") or moats will generate temporary clouds of steam.

## Description

Clouds allow unobstructed passage, but block line of sight - while inside a cloud square, characters can see out of it, although adjacent cloud squares will block vision as normal.

### Plane of Air

Clouds on the Plane of Air are much larger in size: they move around and are occasionally subject to storms, which emit rays of [lightning](/wiki/Lightning "Lightning"). If a character is inside the clouds when lightning strikes, they are [paralyzed](/wiki/Paralyzed "Paralyzed") for a few turns, ignoring [free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## History

Clouds first appear in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), when the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") [branch](/wiki/Branch "Branch"), the Big Room and the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes") were introduced to the game.

## Variants

Variants tend to make clouds somewhat more common in the dungeon.

### Lethe patch

In the [Lethe patch](/wiki/Lethe_patch "Lethe patch"), the [Lethe Gorge](/wiki/Lethe_Gorge "Lethe Gorge")'s seventh level has some small clouds near the temple in the northwest.

### Biodiversity patch

The [biodiversity patch](/wiki/Biodiversity_patch "Biodiversity patch")'s [retool](/wiki/Biodiversity_patch "Biodiversity patch") of the [Priest quest](/wiki/Priest_quest "Priest quest") has a home level for priests of the [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight")'s [pantheon](/wiki/Pantheon "Pantheon") that features cloudy terrain.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") has a large cloud bank as its third section. This also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), some [randomly generated rooms](/wiki/Random_vault_\(UnNetHack\) "Random vault (UnNetHack)") may have clouds within them. Clouds are also sometimes generated within the lower levels of [Sheol](/wiki/Sheol "Sheol").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the goal level of the [Madman quest](/wiki/Madman_quest "Madman quest") is surrounded by cloud rather than a wall.

## Encyclopedia entry

I wandered lonely as a cloud  
That floats on high o'er vales and hills,  
When all at once I saw a crowd,  
A host, of golden daffodils;  
Beside the lake, beneath the trees,  
Fluttering and dancing in the breeze.

\[ I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud, by William Wordsworth ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1613](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/timeout.c#L1613)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

A cloud, #, is a dungeon feature that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
    • 2.1 Plane of Air
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 Lethe patch
    • 4.2 Biodiversity patch
    • 4.3 SLASH'EM
    • 4.4 UnNetHack
    • 4.5 dNetHack
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Generation

Clouds appear in the following areas:

  • The home and locate levels of the Wizard quest
  • Variations #1, #8 and #10 of the Big Room (dependent on chance), and
  • The Plane of Air, where far larger clouds appear.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

One of the themed rooms introduced in this version has a chance of generating a cloud at the center of the room. In addition, rays of fire that partially or completely evaporate pools or moats will generate temporary clouds of steam.

Description

Clouds allow unobstructed passage, but block line of sight - while inside a cloud square, characters can see out of it, although adjacent cloud squares will block vision as normal.

Plane of Air

Clouds on the Plane of Air are much larger in size: they move around and are occasionally subject to storms, which emit rays of lightning. If a character is inside the clouds when lightning strikes, they are paralyzed for a few turns, ignoring free action.[1]

History

Clouds first appear in NetHack 3.1.0, when the Quest branch, the Big Room and the Elemental Planes were introduced to the game.

Variants

Variants tend to make clouds somewhat more common in the dungeon.

Lethe patch

In the Lethe patch, the Lethe Gorge's seventh level has some small clouds near the temple in the northwest.

Biodiversity patch

The biodiversity patch's retool of the Priest quest has a home level for priests of the Knight's pantheon that features cloudy terrain.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the Lawful Quest has a large cloud bank as its third section. This also applies to SlashTHEM and Hack'EM.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, some randomly generated rooms may have clouds within them. Clouds are also sometimes generated within the lower levels of Sheol.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, the goal level of the Madman quest is surrounded by cloud rather than a wall.

Encyclopedia entry

I wandered lonely as a cloud
That floats on high o'er vales and hills,
When all at once I saw a crowd,
A host, of golden daffodils;
Beside the lake, beneath the trees,
Fluttering and dancing in the breeze.

[ I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud, by William Wordsworth ]

References

  1. ↑ src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1613

{{features}}
{{distinguish|poison cloud}}
{{otheruses}}

A '''cloud''', {{lightgray|#}}[[Image:Cloud.png]], is a [[dungeon feature]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
Clouds appear in the following areas:

* The home and locate levels of the [[Wizard quest]]
* Variations #1, #8 and #10 of the [[Big Room]] (dependent on chance), and
* The [[Plane of Air]], where far larger clouds appear.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|One of the [[themed room]]s introduced in this version has a chance of generating a cloud at the center of the room. In addition, rays of fire that partially or completely evaporate [[pool]]s or moats will generate temporary clouds of steam.}}

==Description==
Clouds allow unobstructed passage, but block line of sight - while inside a cloud square, characters can see out of it, although adjacent cloud squares will block vision as normal.

===Plane of Air===
Clouds on the Plane of Air are much larger in size: they move around and are occasionally subject to storms, which emit rays of [[lightning]]. If a character is inside the clouds when lightning strikes, they are [[paralyzed]] for a few turns, ignoring [[free action]].{{refsrc|src/timeout.c|1613|nethack=3.6.7}}

==History==
Clouds first appear in [[NetHack 3.1.0]], when the [[Quest]] [[branch]], the Big Room and the [[Elemental Planes]] were introduced to the game.

==Variants==
Variants tend to make clouds somewhat more common in the dungeon.

===Lethe patch===
In the [[Lethe patch]], the [[Lethe Gorge]]'s seventh level has some small clouds near the temple in the northwest.

===Biodiversity patch===
The [[biodiversity patch]]'s [[Biodiversity patch|retool]] of the [[Priest quest]] has a home level for priests of the [[Knight]]'s [[pantheon]] that features cloudy terrain.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], the [[Lawful Quest]] has a large cloud bank as its third section. This also applies to [[SlashTHEM]] and [[Hack'EM]].

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], some [[Random vault (UnNetHack)|randomly generated rooms]] may have clouds within them. Clouds are also sometimes generated within the lower levels of [[Sheol]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], the goal level of the [[Madman quest]] is surrounded by cloud rather than a wall.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
I wandered lonely as a cloud
That floats on high o'er vales and hills,
When all at once I saw a crowd,
A host, of golden daffodils;
Beside the lake, beneath the trees,
Fluttering and dancing in the breeze.
|[ I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud, by William Wordsworth ]
}}
